com.designpatterns.sensors

Class Led

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.designpatterns.sensors.Led
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ToggleableSensor

    public class Led
extends java.lang.Object
implements ToggleableSensor
    This class simulates interaction with a 3rd party LED sensor for GrovePi. Note this is a dumbed down version of the actual sensor implementation that can be found here: https://github.com/DexterInd/GrovePi/blob/master/Software/Java/src/com/dexterind/grovepi/sensors/Led.java
    Author:
    Chad Williams

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_BRIGHTNESS 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Led(java.lang.String ledIdentifier)
      Create a new LED with the passed identifier.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SensorStatus getStatus()
      Returns the current status of the LED.
      (package private) void setBrightness(float percent)
      Sets the LED brightness to the specified percentage of the maximum brightness, note dimming only works if connected to a pin that supports PWM otherwise this will just appear to turn the LED on/off.
      (package private) void setStatus(SensorStatus status)
      Set the status of the LED to the passed status.
      SensorStatus toggle()
      Toggles the LED on/off.
      java.lang.String toString() 
      (package private) void turnOff()
      Turns the LED off.
      void turnOn()
      Turns the LED on to the maximum brightness.
      (package private) boolean write(int value)
      Set the analog value of the LED and sensor status.

    • Method Detail

      • turnOn

        public void turnOn()
        Turns the LED on to the maximum brightness.

      • turnOff

        void turnOff()
        Turns the LED off.

      • setBrightness

        void setBrightness(float percent)
        Sets the LED brightness to the specified percentage of the maximum brightness, note dimming only works if connected to a pin that supports PWM otherwise this will just appear to turn the LED on/off.
        Parameters:
        percent - Percentage of maximum brightness, expects a number from 0 to 100

      • write

        boolean write(int value)
        Set the analog value of the LED and sensor status.
        Parameters:
        value - Expects a value from 0 to MAX_BRIGHTNESS
        Returns:
